intro: Sponia scaberrima, commonly known as the rough sponia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and serrated, rough-textured leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Sponia scaberrima is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions.
